head.title: School Vouchers: The Right Path?; Public and Private

hedline.hl1: School Vouchers: The Right Path?; Public and Private

block.p: In ''Vouchers That Win'' (Op-Ed, Oct. 11), Felicia Wong correctly observes that it is unfair to make disadvantaged children attend failing public schools, and she correctly recommends spending to solve the problem. But the spending she recommends -- vouchers -- requires taxpayers to subsidize private schools.

In ''Vouchers That Win'' (Op-Ed, Oct. 11), Felicia Wong correctly observes that it is unfair to make disadvantaged children attend failing public schools, and she correctly recommends spending to solve the problem. But the spending she recommends -- vouchers -- requires taxpayers to subsidize private schools.

As a taxpayer, I would prefer to have my tax dollars used to improve failing public schools rather than to subsidize private ones. Voucher plans do not address the inequities in our financing of public schools, and fairness requires that we do so.
